Uses of Package
ray.rage.rendersystem.states

  • Packages that use ray.rage.rendersystem.states 
    Package Description
    ray.rage.rendersystem  
    ray.rage.rendersystem.gl4  
    ray.rage.rendersystem.states  
    ray.rage.scene  
    ray.rage.scene.generic  
  • Classes in ray.rage.rendersystem.states used by ray.rage.rendersystem 
    Class and Description
    RenderState
    A render state has information about settings that should be applied to the underlying graphics driver in use by the render-system implementation.
    RenderState.Type
    The type of state that a particular instance may apply.
  • Classes in ray.rage.rendersystem.states used by ray.rage.rendersystem.gl4 
    Class and Description
    FrontFaceState
    A front-face state determines which side, or "face", of a primitive should be drawn.
    FrontFaceState.VertexWinding
    Specifies the vertex or index sequence pattern to use to determine what the "front" and "back" faces of a renderable are.
    RenderState
    A render state has information about settings that should be applied to the underlying graphics driver in use by the render-system implementation.
    RenderState.Type
    The type of state that a particular instance may apply.
    TextureState
    A texture state determines which textures will be used, how they'll be applied, filtered, stored in GPU memory, and other properties.
    TextureState.ColorComponents
    The color components specify which basic colors are represented and whether alpha transparency is included.
    TextureState.MagnificationFilter
    A magnification filter is a texture filtering function, used whenever the pixel being textured maps to an area less than or equal to that of one texel.
    TextureState.MemoryFormat
    The memory format describes the space storage requirement for each data "value".
    TextureState.MinificationFilter
    A minification filter is a texture filtering function.
    TextureState.PixelFormat
    The pixel format is describes the internal image data available for each pixel.
    TextureState.Target
    A texture target is specifies the type of textures that are supported.
    TextureState.WrapMode
    The wrap mode is a function that determines how texture coordinates will be used to map texels to pixels.
    ZBufferState
    A z-buffer state has information about settings related to depth testing.
    ZBufferState.TestFunction
    The type of depth testing function to use.
